# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Here is a function to wrap text to a specified width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    curr_line = ""
    lines = String[]
    
    for word in words
        if length(curr_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, curr_line)
            curr_line = ""
        end

        if isempty(curr_line)
            curr_line = word
        else
            curr_line = curr_line * " " * word
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, curr_line)
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

It splits the input text into words, then iterates through the words, adding them to the current line. If adding the next word would exceed the text width, it starts a new line. 

Here is an example:

```julia
text = "This function will wrap words into lines"
print(wrap_string(text))
```

```
lines
```

The key aspects are:

- Split text into words 
- Iterate through words
- Track current line 
- Start new line when text width exceeded
- Join lines with newline at the end
